youtube.title: SE Latest Release Playlist
youtube.description: A curated list of new Street Epistemology videos.

se_guide.title: The Complete Street Epistemology Guide
se_guide.description: The guide is a community resource created and maintained by members of the Street Epistemology Facebook group. Thank you everyone for your valuable contributions!

se_podcast.title: The Street Epistemology Podcast
se_podcast.description: Everything you have ever wanted to know about Street Epistemology in audio form. Also available on Stitcher, Spotify, and iTunes.

impossible.title: How To Have Impossible Conversations
impossible.description: "This is a self-help book on how to argue effectively, conciliate, and gently persuade. The authors admit to getting it wrong in their own past conversations. One by one, I recognize the same mistakes in me. The world would be a better place if everyone read this book." -- Richard Dawkins, author of Science in the Soul and Outgrowing God

atheos.title: Atheos App
atheos.description: Atheos is an app developed by Dr. Peter Boghossian and his team, and sponsored by the Richard Dawkins Foundation, to help people have non-confrontational discussions about gods, religion, faith, and superstition.

blog.title: SE Blog
blog.description: People familiar with Street Epistemology share their tips and experiences here with you.

community.title: SE Community
community.description: Street Epistemology is worldwide. Interact with others who are learning and practicing the method.

content_creators.title: SE Content Creators
content_creators.description: There are hundreds of video examples of Street Epistemology in action. Watch some now!

faq.title: FAQ
faq.description: The most common Street Epistemology-related questions are answered here.

amca.title: A Manual for Creating Atheists
amca.description: The term "Street Epistemology" originates in Dr. Peter Boghossian's book, "A Manual for Creating Atheists". In the book, Dr. Boghossian describes how people often use faith as an epistemology.

acronyms.title: List of Common Acronyms used in Street Epistemology
acronyms.description: Here you'll find a list of commonly used acronyms used in the street epistemology community and what they stand for.

se_style.title: SE Logo Style Guide
se_style.description: Official information about how you can use the Street Epistemology logo and download links for the logo files.

drive.title: SE Public Drive
drive.description: This read-only public drive includes Street Epistemology slides, videos and images from past presentations and workshops for your convenience.

discord.title: Discord Server
discord.description: Discord is a group chat application, and you are invited to join in the conversation!

study_group.title: Facebook SE Study Group
study_group.description: This group is for people to learn about and discuss SE.

reddit.title: Reddit
reddit.description: Join the subreddit for sharing the latest updates, ideas, and content related to SE.

learn_group.title: Facebook Learn SE Group
learn_group.description: This group is for helping people learn the principles, methods, and techniques of street epistemology.

twitter.title: Twitter
twitter.description: Follow the official Street Epistemology Twitter account for short updates.

youtube.title: YouTube
youtube.description: Check out the official SE YouTube channel and other active channels!

chat_group.title: Facebook "Chat With a Street Epistemologist" Group
chat_group.description: This group is for facilitating SE discussions over particular beliefs.

critique_group.title: Facebook Critique SE Group
critique_group.description: This group is for raising and discussing any critiques of SE so that we can further learn about and improve the method.

public_group.title: Public SE Facebook Page
public_group.description: A public page for believers and non-believers to discuss topics related to Street Epistemology.

anthony_magnabosco.title: Anthony Magnabosco
anthony_magnabosco.description: Hundreds of Street Epistemology examples on dozens of topics.

cordial_curiosity.title: Cordial Curiosity
cordial_curiosity.description: Reid Nicewonder practices cool-headed conversation instead of heated debate using Street Epistemology.

lets_chat.title: Let's Chat
lets_chat.description: Tyrone strives to demonstrate that people can have productive chats about anything.

deep_discussions.title: Deep Discussions
deep_discussions.description: Eddie practices Street Epistemology in Tyler, Texas and focuses on teaching SE by demonstration and commentary.

street_knowledge.title: Street Knowledge
street_knowledge.description: Street Knowledge hits the streets to speak with people about how they know what they know.

abstract_activist.title: Abstract Activist SE
abstract_activist.description: Are we open minded to the idea that we might be close minded? What would it take to find out?

campefire_convos.title: Campfire Convos
campefire_convos.description: Blending Street Epistemology with the primitive tradition of sitting around a campfire. I sometimes allow Collaborators on Discord the opportunity to ask the questions!

mortage_hill_musings.title: Mortgage Hill Musings
mortage_hill_musings.description: Breakdowns of SE interviews / sermons, as well as lectures that highlight critical thinking skills implicit in the scientific method.
